--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Shane Mingins" <shane.mingins@...> 
> What I=
 have seen more is that these developers become "architects"
> whom design =
systems in such a manner that it makes it extremely
> difficult for the T1 =
developer to begin developer testing.  The T1
> developer is not allowed to=
 refactor the "architecture" to aid testing
> and so to implement testing i=
s actually very hard work and you end up
> being the only one who cares.  I=
t's very frustrating.

Hi Shane,

Thank you for the correction.  I should h=
ave mentioned T3 developers
who advance on the technical career ladder (as =
opposed to the
managerial ladder) and become architects.  T3 architects who=
 don't
think about testability when designing the system are probably more
=
"harmful" than T3 managers.

Alberto
